channel.title: Need extreme help with JFrame variables
channel.description:
I'm making a Quiz Maker right now with JFrames and stuff, using NetBeans. So I have the layout done, meaning where you fill out everything. Now on my next Java file, I'd need to make it what you put on the other. Like if someone put "Quiz" at their title, it'd be like this. [i]jTextField1.setText("Quiz");[/i], and I [b]really[/b] need to know what the variable in "Quiz" is, like the text. So that on the other Java file, I can make it appear as that in the second Java file, like [i]quizTitle.setText(*javafile*.jTextField1.VARIABLEOFTHETEXT);[/i] but I can't because I don't know the variable name in the jTextField's text. So if someone could please help me with them, I'd really be thankful :)
~Lin

item.title: Need extreme help with JFrame variables
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Yeah I made a String that was public String quizTitle = jTextField1; and it came up with the code for the actually TextField. Thank you VERY much.

PS: DragonForce ftw

Read full topic
item.source: Need extreme help with JFrame variables

item.title: Need extreme help with JFrame variables
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

It’s called a method.
And, why not just use something like
String haider = jTextField1.getText();
jTextField.setText(haider);

Or you could just do
jTextField1.setText(jTextField1.getText());

But I personally like having Strings for it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need extreme help with JFrame variables

item.title: Need extreme help with JFrame variables
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I’m making a Quiz Maker right now with JFrames and stuff, using NetBeans. So I have the layout done, meaning where you fill out everything. Now on my next Java file, I’d need to make it what you put on the other. Like if someone put “Quiz” at their title, it’d be like this. jTextField1.setText(“Quiz”);, and I really need to know what the variable in “Quiz” is, like the text. So that on the other Java file, I can make it appear as that in the second Java file, like quizTitle.setText(javafile.jTextField1.VARIABLEOFTHETEXT); but I can’t because I don’t know the variable name in the jTextField’s text. So if someone could please help me with them, I’d really be thankful

~Lin
